sourceMeaningMnemonic: The <radical>white</radical> <radical>thread</radical> in your <radical>towel</radical> comes from <kanji>cotton</kanji>. We use cotton to make lots of things, like clothes and bedsheets. But white towels are always made from soft, fluffy cotton.
meaningInfo: Imagine shoving your face into a nice, clean, white cotton towel. Mmm, so fresh.
readingInfo: Picture all of the men lined up, making towels out of pure white cotton. They're all rubbing their faces in the soft cotton whenever they can.
